channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Zimbabwean millennial Kirsty Coventry gets Olympic top job
item.description: Zimbabwean Olympic swimmer Kirsty Coventry has been elected to head the International Olympic Committee. The two-time gold medalist is marking a whole new set of 'firsts.'
item.content:encoded:
Zimbabwean Olympic swimmer Kirsty Coventry has been elected to head the International Olympic Committee. The two-time gold medalist is marking a whole new set of 'firsts.'

(Image credit: Thanassis Stavrakis)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Hollywood filmmaker charged with defrauding Netflix of $11 million
item.description: Director Carl Erik Rinsch sold Netflix a sci-fi series. Instead of finishing it, prosecutors allege he spent some of the streamer's money on his own investments, luxury rentals, five Rolls-Royces, a Ferrari, and more.
item.content:encoded:
Director Carl Erik Rinsch sold Netflix a sci-fi series. Instead of finishing it, prosecutors allege he spent some of the streamer's money on his own investments, luxury rentals, five Rolls-Royces, a Ferrari, and more.

(Image credit: John Sciulli)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: UK court finds men who stole $6 million gold toilet guilty
item.description: The artwork, titled, America, was stolen from the palace where Winston Churchill was born.
item.content:encoded:
The artwork, titled, America, was stolen from the palace where Winston Churchill was born.

(Image credit: WILLIAM EDWARDS/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Manuela LÃ³pez Restrepo

item.title: Federal agency responsible for library and museum funding gets a visit from DOGE
item.description: Keith E. Sonderling is the new acting head of The Institute of Museum and Library Services, the main source of federal funding for libraries and museums across the country. President Trump issued an executive order last week saying he aims to close the agency.
item.content:encoded:
Keith E. Sonderling is the new acting head of The Institute of Museum and Library Services, the main source of federal funding for libraries and museums across the country. President Trump issued an executive order last week saying he aims to close the agency.

(Image credit: Shannon Finney)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: 3 people face federal charges for Tesla attacks. Are such acts domestic terrorism?
item.description: Attorney General Pamela Bondi says the accused are part of a "wave of domestic terrorism." Experts say this is a common stance of the federal government and can be used to seek stiffer penalties.
item.content:encoded:
Attorney General Pamela Bondi says the accused are part of a "wave of domestic terrorism." Experts say this is a common stance of the federal government and can be used to seek stiffer penalties.

(Image credit: Ethan Miller)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Building a Tech Industry in Syria From Scratch
item.description: Recently a few hundred people gathered at a Damascus hotel to discuss how to jump-start Syria's tech industry. That sector was basically non-existent during Syria's long civil war. Our correspondent attended the conference and met a young man who fled Syria during the civil war and now is a graduate student at Stanford. His journey illustrates both the possibilities and challenges that lie ahead for Syria.
item.content:encoded: Recently a few hundred people gathered at a Damascus hotel to discuss how to jump-start Syria's tech industry. That sector was basically non-existent during Syria's long civil war. Our correspondent attended the conference and met a young man who fled Syria during the civil war and now is a graduate student at Stanford. His journey illustrates both the possibilities and challenges that lie ahead for Syria.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Judge calls 'woefully insufficient' the Trump administration response to his order
item.description: Judge James Boasberg had earlier asked the Trump administration to provide more details about weekend flights that deported hundreds of alleged Venezuelan gang members to El Salvador â despite his order to turn the planes around.
item.content:encoded:
Judge James Boasberg had earlier asked the Trump administration to provide more details about weekend flights that deported hundreds of alleged Venezuelan gang members to El Salvador â despite his order to turn the planes around.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Why don't we remember being babies? Brain scans reveal new clues
item.description: Why can't we remember when we were babies? Scientists who scanned infants' brains found that they do make memories. The findings suggest these memories may still exist, but are inaccessible to us.
item.content:encoded:
Why can't we remember when we were babies? Scientists who scanned infants' brains found that they do make memories. The findings suggest these memories may still exist, but are inaccessible to us.

(Image credit: 160/90)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Why a DOJ prosecutor resigned, telling coworkers and bosses 'you serve no man'
item.description: Former Assistant U.S. Attorney Sean Murphy resigned from the Department of Justice, telling NPR, 'It just was not a Department of Justice that I any longer wanted to associate with.'"
item.content:encoded:
Former Assistant U.S. Attorney Sean Murphy resigned from the Department of Justice, telling NPR, 'It just was not a Department of Justice that I any longer wanted to associate with.'"

(Image credit: Stefani Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: Trump suspends $175 million in funding to University of Pennsylvania over trans athletes
item.description: The University of Pennsylvania found itself at the center of the trans athlete debate when one of its trans students won a series of events during the 2022 swim season.
item.content:encoded:
The University of Pennsylvania found itself at the center of the trans athlete debate when one of its trans students won a series of events during the 2022 swim season.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise
